subsc: Other social services,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector
trustfund:
TF051230-JSDF SEED-ETHIOPIA: PASTORAL
            COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF050614-PHRD-ETHIOPIA: PASTORAL
            COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Government of Ethiopia has requested
            IDA financing for the Pastoral Community Development Project
            (PCDP). Positive and negative impacts are expected to arise.
            Long-term poverty reduction in pastoral areas of Ethiopia is
            closely associated with environmental sustainability, and
            with minimizing potentially negative environmental impacts
            of development and humanitarian aid. Disaster preparedness
            and sustainable livelihoods among Ethiopia pastorals depend
            directly on environmental resources: water, forage
            resources, and their interaction with livestock. There may
            be induced environmental impacts that occur as a result of
            the project on local economies and society. The effects of a
            large number of small developments may have significant
            environmental impacts. The project will adopt mitigation
            measures such as protection and management of natural
            resources and drought contingency planning; training for
            community leaders, and regional officers on the use of the
            environmental screening and reporting system; training for
            regional bureau officials on environmental impact
            assessment, and the use of environmental guidelines in
            identifying and costing mitigation measures.
